newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares fall, seen extending loss.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares fall, seen extending loss.

text.p: Polish shares fell in lower turnover on Thursday and analysts saw more losses in the next few sessions amid profit-taking after the 9.3-percent growth since September 6.

The main market's WIG index fell two percent on Thursday to 14,536.9 and turnover fell 32.8 percent to 114.7 million zlotys ($41 million) on both markets as 58 issues fell, eight rose and 11 were flat.

"Prices of several stocks have risen very high so taking profits is a natural reaction and I believe there are no fundamental reasons for the fall," said Michal Szczurek, an analyst at ING BSK Asset Management.
Analysts said 14,300 or 14,000 points of the WIG index should provide strong support for the market, which was likely to rebound after the profit-taking.

They said companies' August earnings reports, which for the second consecutive month proved better than in the disappointing first half, might keep the mood positive, but had been partially priced-in.
They said Thursday's biggest losers, engineering firm Remak, construction company Espebepe and tyremaker Stomil Olsztyn, all fell after presenting unspectacular results.
Analysts also said that top gainers furniture maker Forte and paint maker Polifarb Cieszyn benefitted from particularily strong August earnings.
The bourse suspended trade in carpet maker Novita after the firm failed to present its August earnings on Wednesday.
Continuous trade turnover amounted to 2.4 million zlotys ($0.9 million) with the biggest mover steel trader Stalexport down 3.6 percent.
